ResourceHeader.ResourceName: SOHO Charge, Element, and Isotope Analysis System (CELIAS) Proton Monitor 30 Second Solar Wind data

RevisionEvent.Note: Only known prior ReleaseDate of the metadata

ResourceHeader.Description: The Proton Monitor is a solar wind Energy per Charge (E/Q) analyzer of a new design, consisting of a three-box deflection system followed by a wedge-shaped MicroChannel Plate (MCP) assembly. The data are derived from sets of 6 rates (one for each voltage step of the PM deflection system) obtained every 30 seconds. The voltage steps are spaced logarithmically (about 60% step size) from about 0.3 to 3 kV. At a given voltage step the energy per charge dynamic range is slightly more than a factor of 2. The overall geometry factor of the PM is about 1.0 x 10^-4 cm^2.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: Please acknowledge the University of Maryland Space Physics Group

InformationURL.Name: SOHO Celias Proton Monitor Home Page
InformationURL.Description: Site hosting instrument information, some data and plots for SOHO Celias PM

AccessURL.Name: Proton Monitor Data at UMD
AccessURL.Description: CELIAS Proton Monitor repository at UMD

NumericalData.Caveats: On rare occassions the spacecraft's roll angle is changed for brief periods, during which the derived flow direction will refer to a different plane. A list of such times is available at http://umtof.umd.edu/pm/roll.html. In addition, since SOHO is not a spinning spacecraft, the deflection system was designed to have a wide angular acceptance (+- 15 deg). For technical reasons this leads to an ambiguity between incident angle and incident energy/charge; this ambiguity was designed into the PM to match as closely as possible the behavior of the deflection system for the main MTOF sensor. It is not the energy/charge but rather the mass/charge that is needed for interpretation of the MTOF mass data.

Parameter.Name: Time
Parameter.Description: Colon seperated day of year, hour, minute and second (doy:HH:MM:SS)

Parameter.Name: Proton Density
Parameter.Caveats: Parameters are derived from a combination of fitting and moment techniques

Parameter.Name: Proton Thermal Speed
Parameter.Caveats: Parameters are derived from a combination of fitting and moment techniques

Parameter.Name: Proton arrival direction
Parameter.Description: Proton arrival direction in degrees from north/south with positive meaning from the south

Parameter.Name: GSE X
Parameter.Description: GSE X Component of SOHO position vector based on predicted orbit files ( 1 Re = 6378 km )

Parameter.Name: GSE Y
Parameter.Description: GSE Y Component of SOHO position vector based on predicted orbit files ( 1 Re = 6378 km )

Parameter.Name: GSE Z
Parameter.Description: GSE Z Component of SOHO position vector based on predicted orbit files ( 1 Re = 6378 km )

Parameter.Name: Heliocentric Range
Parameter.Description: Heliocentric Range of SOHO in 10^6 km
